Author: ThomasBlock#6830
phm87#7395
Content: Komodo is transparent only tx. The ztransactions are disabled now. You can do tx between transparent addresses. Do not try to shield kmd

Author: smellycouch#3071
Content: dumb question...   actually I'm sort of answering it myself but I'm not confident enough in the answer...

Author: smellycouch#3071
Content: so, anyone can easy-mine to a notary pubkey if they really feel the urge

Author: smellycouch#3071
Content: what would stop someone from setting up 64 easy-mining nodes and mining 80 out of the next 100 blocks?

Author: smellycouch#3071
Content: Or, is there really nothing stopping that, except the fact that there is no incentive,

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: not allowed

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: notary mined needs to be notary signed too

Author: smellycouch#3071
Content: as in it needs to prove that it owns the address to the pubkey?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes

Author: smellycouch#3071
Content: ah ok.   thank you.    this historical chat was helpful to me lol:  https://supernet.useresponse.com/topic/how-does-komodo-mining-work

Author: smellycouch#3071
Content: sorry

Author: smellycouch#3071
Content: lol

Author: smellycouch#3071
Content: I'm a problem child

Author: smellycouch#3071
Content: so, i was under the impression that ratification does not happen on every block but just periodicially?  So....am I mistaken, or does this only prevent consecutive forged mining?

Author: smellycouch#3071
Content: Would it still be possible to forge a pubkey for say, one block?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: how?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you need to sign with the matching privkey

Author: smellycouch#3071
Content: "forge" isn't really the right word, sorry,

Author: smellycouch#3071
Content: oh, on every block?  sorry.  I misunderstood then

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if it is easy mined

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is actually not related to notarizations at all

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: just that the same pubkeys that notarize get to easy mine

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: two totally different processes

Author: smellycouch#3071
Content: totally understand, just handled by the same pubkey/smart address

Author: smellycouch#3071
Content: so ratification is also bad terminology.   Basically I understand now that every single easy block must be signed with the private key of the notary pubkey (not ratification), and there is never any external mining of notary pubkeys of any kind except by extreme, extreme luck.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: only the notary privkey can easy mine

Author: smellycouch#3071
Content: thank you kindly

Content: Prior to Overwinter the amount parameter was not required

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: is it possible the documentation wasnt updated?

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: any devs have opinions on database dimensioning?

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: experience > opinions btw 😃

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
i have an option to run:
1) large database with N number of tables
2) large database with 1 table and use an identifier column
3) seperate database for each table

i think i prefer option 3 because then it's not a monolithic admin thing in the future.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: the tables are block data for each chain in the ecosystem

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
so in 12 months time
option 1) would grow by 1 record per block (500k records per year)
option 2) would grow by and obscene amount
option 3) would be like option1 but easier to move servers/services in the future

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: again, i think i prefer option 3.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: if nobody has any experience, i'll ask in stackoverflow.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: thanks

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: mySQL?

Author: Decker#3767
Content: @Deleted User since sapling is activated know amount of each vin is mandatory to sign transaction, bcz it's part of preimage hash. Read ZIP-0243 https://github.com/zcash/zips/blob/master/zip-0243.rst for details.

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: I would do separate DB for each year (if you logging blockchain blocks)  with proper indexing.

Author: Oszy#5734
Content:
1 db with 1 table can get very messy, not at the beginning but later.
ofc it depends on the number of rows in the table and how you optimize the queries

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: my advise, try it all, and compare speed. fill up the db with dummy data, and test.  it also depends on how you host the db, locally or cloud, and what the server resources are.

Author: Alright#0419
Content: it's required if you're signing a tx with a daemon that has no knowledge of the previous utxos if I remember correctly

Author: Alright#0419
Content: not required for everything, but for example, if you wanted to sign a KMD tx with an assetchain daemon, you would need to provide it
